guides.title: User Guides
guides.subtitle: Learn how to use Mfqod to search for lost items, submit claims, and report missing items.

section1.title: Searching for Items
section1.description: The search page allows you to browse all found items that are waiting to be claimed. You can filter items by type and branch location to help you find what you're looking for.

items.question: How do I search for a lost item?
items.answer: Navigate to the Search page from the main navigation menu. You can browse all available found items or use the filters to narrow down your search by item type and branch location.

items.question: Can I filter items by location?
items.answer: Yes, you can filter items by branch location using the filter options on the search page. This helps you find items that were found in specific locations.

items.question: What information is shown for each item?
items.answer: Each item displays its title, description, location (branch), item type, and images if available. Click on an item to view more details.

items.question: Do I need to be logged in to search?
items.answer: Yes, you need to be logged in to access the search page and view item details. If you're not logged in, you'll be redirected to the login page.

section2.title: Submitting a Claim
section2.description: If you find an item in the search results that matches your lost property, you can submit a claim. Provide detailed information to help verify that the item belongs to you.

items.question: How do I submit a claim for an item?
items.answer: When viewing an item's details, click the 'Submit Claim' button. Fill in the claim form with your contact information and details about why you believe this item belongs to you. Be as specific as possible to help verify your claim.

items.question: What information should I provide in my claim?
items.answer: Provide your name, contact information, and a detailed description explaining why you believe the item is yours. Include any unique features, marks, or details that can help verify your ownership.

items.question: What happens after I submit a claim?
items.answer: Your claim will be reviewed by the item owner or administrator. You'll receive notifications about the status of your claim. If approved, you can arrange to collect the item from the specified branch location.

items.question: Can I submit multiple claims?
items.answer: Yes, you can submit claims for multiple items if you believe they match your lost property. Each claim will be reviewed independently.

section3.title: Reporting Missing Items
section3.description: If you've lost an item, you can report it as missing. This helps others identify your item if it's found and reported in the system.

items.question: How do I report a missing item?
items.answer: After logging in, navigate to 'Report Missing Item' from the dashboard or navigation menu. Fill in all required fields including the item title, description, location where it was lost, and upload images if available.

items.question: What information is required when reporting a missing item?
items.answer: You need to provide: item title, detailed description, the location where you lost it (branch), item type, and optionally upload images. The more details you provide, the better chance of matching it with found items.

items.question: Can I edit my missing item report?
items.answer: Yes, you can edit your missing item reports from the Missing Items page in your dashboard. Find your report and click on it to view details, then use the 'Edit' button to make changes.

items.question: Will I be notified if someone finds my item?
items.answer: Yes, if a found item matches your missing item report, you'll receive a notification. Administrators may also link found items to your missing item report.

analytics.title: Analytics Dashboard
analytics.subtitle: Track lost and found items performance

help.title: How to Use
help.subtitle: Learn how to use the Mfqod platform effectively with these helpful guides.

section1.title: Getting Started
section1.description: Welcome to Mfqod! This guide will help you navigate the platform and make the most of its features.

items.question: How do I access the dashboard?
items.answer: After logging in, you will be automatically redirected to the dashboard. You can also access it from the navigation menu at any time.

items.question: What permissions do I need to manage items?
items.answer: You need the 'can_manage_items' permission to access item management features. Contact your administrator if you don't have this permission.

items.question: How do I navigate between different sections?
items.answer: Use the sidebar navigation menu on the left to access different sections of the dashboard. Click on any menu item to navigate to that section.

section2.title: Reporting Items
section2.description: Learn how to report found items and missing items. Follow these steps to ensure your reports are complete and accurate.

items.question: How do I report a found item?
items.answer: Navigate to 'Report Found Item' from the sidebar menu. Fill in all required fields including title, description, location, and upload images if available. Click 'Submit' to create your report.

items.question: What information is required when reporting?
items.answer: You need to provide: item title, description, location (branch), item type, and at least one image. Additional details help increase the chances of returning the item to its owner.

items.question: Can I edit a report after submitting?
items.answer: Yes, you can edit your reports from the Items page. Find your item and click on it to view details, then use the 'Edit' button to make changes.

section3.title: Managing Items
section3.description: Discover how to manage items, update their status, and handle claims efficiently.

items.question: How do I filter items by status?
items.answer: Use the status filter buttons at the top of the Items page. You can filter by Pending, Approved, or Cancelled status. The default view shows pending items.

items.question: What does 'My Managed Items' mean?
items.answer: 'My Managed Items' shows only items from branches you manage. 'All Items' shows items from all branches in the system. Use the view mode toggle to switch between these views.

items.question: How do I approve or cancel an item?
items.answer: Open the item details page and use the status dropdown to change the item status. Select 'Approved' to make it visible in search, or 'Cancelled' to remove it from active listings.

section4.title: Search and Claims
section4.description: Find out how to search for items and submit claims for items that match your lost property.

items.question: How do I search for a lost item?
items.answer: Use the search page accessible from the main navigation. Enter keywords related to your lost item, such as its type, color, or description. You can also filter by item type and branch location.

items.question: How do I submit a claim for an item?
items.answer: When you find a matching item in search results, click on it to view details. If it matches your lost item, click the 'Submit Claim' button and provide verification details. The item owner will review your claim.

items.question: What happens after I submit a claim?
items.answer: Your claim will be reviewed by the item owner or administrator. You'll receive notifications about the status of your claim. If approved, you can arrange to collect the item from the specified location.
